title: Ticket #6675: Fix manpage URLs
description:
Now that we're building the HTML manual with htlatex, the URLs use the sections' names, not their numbers. This is wonderful and should result in stable (between manual revision) links, except that the man pages are all named 'labelmancondorwhoCondorwho.html', instead of something useful or memorable like 'condor_who.html' or 'condorwho.html' or even 'manCondorWho.html'.

I'd fix them the same way I did our section titles (with perl -p -i -e), except they've got a lot of \Condor{name} commands embedded in them, which is a pain. Anyway, we've got a lot files that start like 

\begin{ManPage}{\label{x}Name}{1}{descr}

which should be 

\begin{ManPage}{x}{Name}{1}{descr}

with the ManPage definition changed to match (so that the \label{} immediately follows the \section{}, like everywhere else).
